github.copilot.chat.commitMessageGenerat.text: Structure commit messages as '<type>(<scope>): <brief description>' with type being feat/fix/docs/chore, and scope indicating 2+ parent directories (e.g., 'feat(data-parser): Add CSV validation').
Explicitly list file-specific changes using concise bullet points in the message body (e.g., '- config_loader.py: Implement environment-aware parsing' or '- utils.rs: Add error propagation helpers').
For multi-file modifications, group changes by functional relationship: 'Core updates: logger.cpp (Add timestamps), log_formatter.h (ISO-8601 compliance)'. Limit to 1 line per logical change set.
Explicitly mention language-specific implementations (e.g., 'Applied Rust ownership pattern' or 'Used Python context managers') aligned with each file's tech stack.

Add 'run-ci' on a new line at the end of the commit message body (separated by an empty line) for all changes by default. When in doubt, always include 'run-ci'. Only omit for changes that exclusively modify documentation or comments with absolutely no code, configuration, or dependency changes.
